Ciaran can't be blocked except by creatures with one of the chosen names.

rulings.text: Only names of actual creature cards can be used. For example, Wandering Fumarole cannot be named even if a Wandering Fumarole on the battlefield is currently a creature. Similarly, most tokens cannot be named, with the exception of tokens with names that are also creature card names. At the time of this ruling, the only such tokens other than token copies are Assembly-Worker, Cloud Sprite, Festering Goblin, Goldmeadow Harrier, Kobolds of Kher Keep, Llanowar Elves, Metallic Sliver, Nightmare, Shapeshifter, and Spark Elemental.

cards.name: Path of Strength
cards.originalText:
When Path of Strength enters the battlefield, journey twice. (To journey, exile the top card of your library face up. Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, put a journeyed card you own into your hand.)
At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you own a journeyed card in exile, target creature you control gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.

rulings.text: The cards are journeyed one at a time. If the second card from the top is a face-up card with premonition, you cast the card, then journey the card that was originally third from the top. This is a change from previous rulings.

cards.originalText:
Desperation (This creature may despair as it attacks. If it does, sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.)
When Lautrec, the Embraced despairs, defending player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it and exile it. You may cast that card for as long as it remains exiled, and you may spend mana as though it were mana of any type to cast that spell.

rulings.text: The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless. The despair trigger doesn't allow you to spend mana as though it were mana from, say, an artifact source or a snow source.

cards.name: Thorned Slayer
cards.originalText:
You may have Thorned Slayer assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
{1}, Sacrifice another creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Thorned Slayer.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or permanent this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned “as though it weren't blocked”.
